info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:14PM CDT until April 01 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE AND WESTERN HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 1113 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Bolivar to 7 miles north of Slayden, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Whiteville, Somerville, Lagrange, Middleton, Moscow, Williston, Grand Junction, La Grange, Hickory Valley, Saulsbury, Rogers Springs, Laconia, Middleburg, Pattersonville, Van Buren, Forty Five, Powers and Ghost River State Natural Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
